Sgor Gaibhre

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

Sgor Gaibhre is a remote Munro above Loch Ossian in the heart of the Highlands. It is usually climbed either from Rannoch or Corrour stations on the West Highland railway line.

 You have not climbed Sgor Gaibhre.

Region: Fort William

Altitude: 955 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.38/5
Rating: 3.4/5 (53 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Carn Dearg and Sgor Gaibhre from Corrour Station

Other routes and challenges

The two Munros can also be climbed from the B846 near Rannoch Station, starting over Beinn Pharlagain but then continuing round the horseshoe of ridges.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Fort William Hotels

Fort William B&B

Fort William Cottages

Lochaber Hostels

Panoramic summit view (click to open)





Users' walk reports for Sgor Gaibhre

There are 2722 Walkhighlanders who have climbed Sgor Gaibhre. They have contributed 69 public walk reports including this summit. These are ordered below with the most popular ones first. The rightmost column shows how many summits were included in their report, which may help you to find the most relevant reports.
